intro: Boehmeria cuspidata, commonly known as Chinese nettle or hill nettle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and alternate leaves with serrated edges. Its small greenish-white flowers are clustered in panicles, and it produces small, round fruits. Boehmeria cuspidata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
